We are Glassbox, the world's leader in digital experience intelligence (DXI), and on a mission to deliver frictionless digital journeys to leading brands and their customers all over the world.

We are a hyper-growth scale-up company that continues to grow quarter-on-quarter and our customers love us - named a 2022 leader in nine G2 categories based on customer reviews!

Will you join us on this journey?

Internal Communication - a Must:

Who are we?

Together, we’re on a mission to make good health more affordable and accessible, to help millions around the world enjoy healthier lives. It’s a mission that bonds our people across nearly 60 countries and a rich, diverse variety of nationalities and backgrounds.
Working here means working with the world’s leading manufacturer of generic medicines, and the proud producer of many of the products on the World Health Organization’s Essential Medicines List. Today, at least 200 million people around the world take one of our medicines every single day. An amazing number, but we’re always looking for new ways to continue making a difference, and new people to make a difference with.

Job Description

The Director, ITMO Strategy & Portfolio Mgmt. is responsible for establishing and maintaining the smooth running of the IT operations from strategic planning through project execution.
Specific responsibilities include:
Strategic Planning - Establish and manage the process for building and maintaining the long-range strategic plan for IT and Systems information Strategic Plan.
Annual Planning - Establish and manage the process for creating and approving the annual operating plan including detailed CAPEX planning and alignment with Finance and HR on OPEX and HC. Responsible for tracking the plan throughout the year to ensure adherence and address adjustments.
Management Routines - Develop the routines to ensure the smooth management of the IT department including meetings, reporting and communications points within IT and with the broader organization. Manage the process for requests and approvals of resources.

Operational Efficiency - Establish and Manage the routines and culture for the Operations leads to liaise effectively and efficiently with the assigned IT departments to enable smooth operations and management visibility to the complete picture of projects, people, and financials.
Cross IT Initiatives - Identify and manage cross IT initiatives and projects. Oversee delivery across the various delivery groups within the IT organization.
Incubation - Identify and collect opportunities to expand the tools and capabilities of IT into new spaces. Serve as the location to establish the capability and move it into an operational status within the organization.

10+ years of experience in senior/managerial IT role
10+ years of experience implementing and managing global scale applications
Management-related Degree, or other applicable field preferred

Skills and Capabilities:
Strategic Thinking – Ability to think long term and align IT to broader organizational goals and plans.
Relationship Management – Ability to manage competing priorities and maintain relationships with senior IT leaders without compromising on quality and standards.
Analysis and Problem Solving – Ability to break down complex issues into their root causes and define realistic solutions.
Communication and Change Management – Ability to communicate complex ideas and plans in clear and actionable ways. Capability to help drive an organization through changes in process and strategy.

Riskified empowers merchants and shoppers to realize the full potential of eCommerce by making it safe, accessible, and frictionless. Work collaboratively with multiple teams, including Dev, Integration, SRE, Operations and BI teams, to scope and solve complex analytical and technical product problems
Own the solution API definition making sure that we address the latest market requirements to support Riskified business goals
Think big. Work with GTM teams to understand the business needs, define creative solutions to address those opportunities and prioritize the product development accordingly
Define Non-Functional Requirements of high-availability, high-throughput or Big Data services, incorporating a broad range of considerations and tradeoffs
Own the solution roadmap to meet the business goals
Manage the agile development and release of developer-friendly new features and capabilities to promote synergy and reuse
Define and own KPIs that measure ease of use and reuse of such capabilities
Lead the planning, scoping, and prioritization of new capabilities to achieve Riskified business goals
Qualifications
3+ years of experience as a Product Manager
Experience with large-scale, big-data and cloud-based solutions
Strong technical background, including familiarity with: Relational DBs, NoSQL, AWS Products, big data technologies (Kafka, Spark)
Experience designing APIs and building high throughput services
Fast learner with strong interpersonal and communication skills
3+ years of proven experience in hands-on server-side coding
B.Sc. in Computer Science or military equivalent certifications
Experience in SaaS companies in a B2B setting - an advantage
Experience with eCommerce, FinTech, Online Payments, Fraud - an advantage
